node.title: 'My future is at stake': What it's like growing up in the Pacific, on the frontline of climate change
node.alt: A teenage girl and three young children, hold hands while standing in a body of water.
node.description: Children and young people in the Pacific have grown up in the shadow of climate change, watching rising sea levels swallow landscapes and waiting in fear for the next natural disaster to strike.
node.content:
["Shannon Sogavare, 16, from Solomon Islands has already seen how rising sea levels have swallowed parts of her country's\u00a0landscape.\u00a0", "When the teen was younger, she would visit the islands of Choiseul province where her father, Prime Minister Manasseh Sogavare, grew up.", "\"He would\u00a0tell wonderful stories, like he\u00a0and his brothers playing on the sandy beaches of Nuatabu and having to wake up very early in the morning to go attend church gatherings at the end of the village,\" Shannon says.", "\"The middle part of the island of Nuatabu\u00a0is now fully covered with sea, leaving the island with two \u2026\u00a0separate islands.\"", "She fears\u00a0what the archipelago's landscape will look like in years to come and is acutely aware of the threat climate changes poses to her home.", "", "
Shannon Sogavare says\u00a0parts of the Solomon Islands are now underwater.(ABC News:\u00a0Chrisnrita Aumanu-Leong)
", "\"As a teenager, this issue of climate change is very personal for me, since I myself have a long life to live,\" Shannon says.", "\"And, by looking at how the climate patterns are changing, and how climate change has affected my family [and] village community, I don't actually know what my future would be like, and \u2026\u00a0what the survival of my future would be.\"", "Shannon, like many children and young people in the Pacific, is\u00a0paying close attention to the developments and outcomes of the COP26 conference currently taking place in Glasgow.\u00a0", "The future for the region \u2014\u00a0according to modelling from\u00a0Save the Children's Born into The Climate Crisis report \u2014\u00a0looks grim, with children in Australia and the Pacific predicted to\u00a0experience up to 10 times more extreme weather events than their ancestors.\u00a0", "Worldwide, that figure jumps to 24 times as many climate-induced extreme weather events, for children born in 2020.", "The report says a baby born last\u00a0year\u00a0in\u00a0Papua New Guinea will face 10 times the\u00a0heat waves and\u00a0double the risk of fires than were experienced by their elders.\u00a0", "Meanwhile, children in Vanuatu\u00a0are predicted to face\u00a0nearly three times as many droughts.", "", "
Tanya Watsivi McGarry lives in Vanuatu and has already experienced two severe cyclones in her life.(Supplied:\u00a0Dan McGarry)
", "It is not a future that Tanya\u00a0Watsivi McGarry*, 9, who lives in\u00a0Vanuatu, is willing to accept.", "Even at nine years of age, Tanya\u00a0is\u00a0old enough to remember bunkering down when\u00a0Cyclone Pam tore through her home six years ago.\u00a0", "\"We were all squashed up in the bathroom,\" Tanya\u00a0says, recalling the category five cyclone.", "\"We could hear the glass shattering and the water came up.\"\u00a0", "She rememberers\u00a0feeling \"very scared\", worried about the trees that surrounded her home.\u00a0", "Just last year, her home island of Pentecost was devastated by Cyclone Harold, tearing infrastructure apart and decimating crops and\u00a0resources.\u00a0", "\"It was terrible,\" Tanya says.\u00a0", "\"All the fruits, the vegetables, the island cabbage, all of that was destroyed.", "\"Then it couldn't grow anymore.\"\u00a0", "Growing up in the shadow of climate change, the young girl recognises the role foreign countries will play in the region's future.", "\"There [are] people out there who are trying to do their best and then there [are] people out there who are not trying to do their best,\" she says.", "Tanya's sentiments reflect\u00a0those of Pacific leaders, who have criticised Australia for not having ambitious enough emissions reduction targets.", "Late last month, Australia committed to a target to reach net zero by 2050.", "During his speech to world leaders, Mr Morrison said Australia would increase\u00a0its\u00a0climate finance commitment to its\u00a0Pacific and South-East Asian neighbours by $500 million over the next five years, to reach a total of $2 billion.\u00a0", "
Learning\u00a0to live with the threat
", "In Fiji, Aiyanna Nacewa, 8, and her\u00a0classmates are learning what to do in the event of a cyclone.\u00a0", "\"We learn [if] one big storm hits, we should board up, save our electricity and save our water and food and close up the windows and doors,\"\u00a0Aiyanna says.", "", "
Aiyanna Nacewa worries about the impact of severe weather on her home in Fiji.(Supplied: Alisi Rabukawaqa)
", "While the lessons help\u00a0students\u00a0understand how to prepare for natural disasters, they do little to ease the fear children like Aiyanna have internalised about natural disasters and climate change.\u00a0", "\"When a first cyclone hit with thunder and lightning, I looked outside the window and I was scared because my thoughts were that lightning could hit our house and, and that's when it could make a hole through the roof.\"", "
'My future is at stake'
", "Shannon\u00a0has witnessed\u00a0communities\u00a0searching for food, water and shelter after\u00a0cyclones that have flattened villages in the\u00a0Solomon Islands.", "\"This country is very vulnerable to natural disasters, houses, villages\u00a0and even lives were lost due to natural disasters,\" Shannon says.", "\"I understand that this is not an easy issue that world leaders could address overnight.\u00a0", "\"But I would want the world leaders to please sympathise with us Pacific Island countries, and see how my own people are struggling to survive due to climate change.\u00a0", "\"As a teenager, I want to call on world leaders to try and change things around my family's life, my own life, my future is at stake.\"", "", "
Samoan climate activist Brianna Fruean speaks at the UN Climate Change summit.
", "*Tanya Watsivi McGarry is the daughter of freelance journalist Dan\u00a0McGarry."]
